newsitem.title: USA: Oracle CFO sees early applications rebound.
newsitem.headline: Oracle CFO sees early applications rebound.

text.p: Oracle Inc's chief financial officer said on Tuesday orders for its computer applications were building, raising expectations that the segment would regain its 100 percent growth rate as early as the current quarter.

Oracle reported flat sales of applications in its first quarter of 1997 ended August. That surprised some observers from outside the company because applications sales had been growing at a 100 percent year-over-year rate in fiscal 1996.
Oracle earlier said it was confident that applications sales growth would regain its fast pace, adding that the first quarter was an anomoly resulting from aggressive fourth-quarter selling.
Chief Financial Officer Jeff Henley on Tuesday confirmed that application sales were rebounding.

On Tuesday, Oracle unveiled what it called its Network Computing Architecture software. It said the technology would allow personal computers or network computers to work with any World Wide Web server, database server and applications server through any network.
